titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I spent most part of the day in writing a criticism of the Abp's 'Statement' about Kikuyu, but, before the day was out, I had practically decided not to send what I had written to the press. For my criticism must needs be severer than is judicious, or, perhaps, fair: and this is no time for anything which could even suggest controversy.

After lunch I attended a meeting of the Council of the Durham Colleges, at which it was decided to open negotiations with the Ecclesiastical Commissioners for the purchase by them of the University's property at Bearpark.
